snippet: In the last month, Oberlin College has been jolted by slurs, swastikas and a late-night sighting of someone in a robe and hood.
abstract: Oberlin College cancels classes and convenes 'day of solidarity' after latest in month-long string of what it called hate-related incidents and vandalism at school known as much for its liberalism as it is for academic excellence.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña reported from Oberlin, and Trip Gabriel from New York.

lead_paragraph: In the last month, Oberlin College has been jolted by slurs, swastikas and a late-night sighting of someone in a robe and hood.

headline.seo: Oberlin Cancels Classes After Series of ‘Hate-Related Incidents’
headline.main: Racist Incidents Stun Campus and Halt Classes at Oberlin
headline.print_headline: Racist Incidents Stun Campus and Halt Classes at Oberlin
